location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.63 of 1852 from Lt-Col Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary of the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: Covering letter, enclosing letter no.27 of 1851 (ff 305-06), from Major Atkins Hamerton, Her Majesty's Consul and the Honourable Company's Agent in the dominions of His Highness the Imam of Muscat, to Hennell, dated 18 December 1851. In his letter, Hamerton details the claims paid out to two British subjects from Bombay, totalling 166 and 125 dollars respectively, resulting from the detention of goods by the Customs Master at Bandar Abbas [Bandar-e ʻAbbās].
